title: Relative vitamin A values of 9-cis- and 13-cis-?-carotene do not differ when fed at physiological levels during vitamin A depletion in Mongolian gerbils (Meriones unguiculatus).
abstract: Provitamin A biofortification of staple crops may decrease the prevalence of vitamin A (VA) deficiency if widely adopted in target countries. To assess the impact of processing methods on the VA value of plant foods, the unique bioefficacies of cis-?C isomers (formed during cooking) compared with all-trans (at) ?-carotene (?C) must be determined. The bioefficacies of 9-cis (9c)- and 13-cis (13c)-?C isomers were compared with those of the at-?C isomer and VA positive (VA+) and negative (VA - ) controls in VA-depleted Mongolian gerbils (Meriones unguiculatus) in two experimental studies (study 1, n 56; study 2, n 57). A 3- or 4-week depletion period was followed by a 3- or 4-week treatment period in which the groups received oral doses of the 9c-, 13c- or at-?C isomers in cottonseed oil (study 1, 15 nmol/d; study 2, 30 nmol/d). In study 1, the ?C isomers did not maintain baseline liver VA stores in all groups (0.69 (SD 0.20) ?mol/liver) except in the VA+group (0.56 (SD 0.10) ?mol/liver) (P= 0.0026). The ?C groups were similar to the VA+group, but the 9c- and 13c-?C groups did not differ from the VA - group (0.39 (SD 0.09) ?mol/liver). In study 2, the ?C isomers maintained baseline liver VA stores in all the ?C groups (0.35 (SD 0.13) ?mol/liver), and in the VA+group, the VA supplement (0.54 (SD 0.19) ?mol/liver) exceeded the baseline VA status (0.38 (SD 0.15) ?mol/liver) (P< 0.0001); however, the 9c-?C group did not differ from the VA - group (0.20 (SD 0.07) ?mol/liver). In vivo isomerisation of ?C was confirmed in both experimental studies. Lower VA bioconversion factor values were obtained for the cis-?C isomers in study 2 when compared with study 1, but higher values were obtained for the at-?C isomer. Dose and VA status clearly affect bioconversion factors. In conclusion, the cis-?C isomers yielded similar liver VA stores to the at-?C isomer in Mongolian gerbils, and liver VA stores of the 9c- and 13c-?C groups did not differ when the doses were provided at physiological levels over time in two studies.
